@31045: The illegals come to the US not just for earning a living and sending remittances home, but also, most likely, for the generous social welfare, free healthcare, and free public education for their children.
While the early law-abiding, bootstrapping European immigrants came when there was no welfare state, so they were fully reliant on themselves. If they ever fail, they would just return to their home country rather than seeking handouts from the government.

Hence... It's safe to assume that with a welfare state, of course border control has to be in place to keep the migrants out from leeching off the system; on the other hand, without a welfare state, there're much fewer incentives for migrants to come, which makes open border possible.

However, I personally do support strict border control even without a welfare state, considering the activities of those international crime syndicates, such as human trafficking and drug trade.
